column4: I am having a problem with my wired internet ETH0 connection.  Toshiba Satellite laptop, it worked a couple of months ago, but I tried to use it yesterday and no connection with no lights at connector - anyone have an idea what could be wrong?
does your /etc/network/interfaces have auto eth0 inet dhcp
how do I check for that?
can you pastebin /etc/network/interfaces ?
- bash: ifconfig/etc/network/interfaces: No such file or directory             Is what I get.  Am I searching correctly?
no, cat /etc/network/interfaces
- Here's what I got:  auto lo
then do sudo ifconfig eth0 up
- how do I add those lines?
open it in gedit or mousepad. guessing you never used nano
- I'm fairly new at working in the terminal.
type sudo gedit /etc/network/interfaces
- tried and this is what I got:  sudo gedit /etc/network/interfaces
you need to add those lines I gave you earlier
http://paste.ubuntu.com/1153257/ see the lines auto eth0 and the line under it add those under the lo stuff
then you can use sudo ifconfig eth0 up to turn on your ethernet
- all I get is "no command auto found"
can you pastebin your /etc/network/interface ??
can you pastebin your /etc/network/interfaces ??
- http://paste.ubuntu.com/1153337/
do this.  sudo apt-get install pastebinit && sudo pastebinit /etc/network/interfaces
- I apparently need to learn a lot more - I DO appreciate your help
- I did sudo apt-get install pastebinit && sudo pastebinit /etc/network/interfaces
does your card show up if you do lspci | grep Ethernet
